qas.question: What part of town is the plant owned by VWN located in?
Which company was founded in Hanover in 1871?
Where does TUI AG host their headquarters?
Which major global reinsurance company has their headquarters east of the city center?
What is the only industrial business located in Hanover?

plausible_answers.text: The Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles Transporter (VWN) factory at Hannover-Stöcken

qas.question: What is the biggest employer in Europe?
Who has a gas burning power plant?
Who holds minority stock in Continental AG?
What types of company does Hanover have that operate around the world?

context: Various industrial businesses are located in Hannover. <b5_0><b6_0>The <a0_0>Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles Transporter<b5_0/><a0_0/> (VWN) factory at Hannover-Stöcken<b6_0/> is the biggest employer in the region and operates a huge plant at the <a1_0>northern edge of town<a1_0/> adjoining the Mittellandkanal and Motorway A2. Jointly with a factory of German tire and automobile parts manufacturer <b7_0>Continental AG<b7_0/>, they have a coal-burning power plant. <a2_0>Continental AG<a2_0/>, founded in Hanover in 1871, is one of the city's major companies, as is Sennheiser. Since 2008 a take-over is in progress: <b8_0>the Schaeffler Group<b8_0/> from Herzogenaurach (Bavaria) holds the majority of the stock but were required due to the financial crisis to deposit the options as securities at banks. TUI AG has its HQ in <a3_0>Hanover<a3_0/>. Hanover is home to many <b9_0>insurance companies<b9_0/>, many of which operate only in Germany. One major global reinsurance company is <a4_0>Hannover Re<a4_0/>, whose headquarters are east of the city centre.
